title: APG-MOS: Auditory Perception Guided-MOS Predictor for Synthetic Speech
author: Zhicheng Lian (Beijing Normal University), Lizhi Wang (Beijing Normal University), Hua Huang (Beijing Normal University), ...
relevance_why: This work integrates auditory perception modeling with deep learning for speech quality assessment, which is directly relevant to Haohe Liu's interest in audio processing and generative AI methodologies.
background: The task is to automatically assess the quality of synthetic speech by approximating human perceptual scores without needing extensive manual evaluations.
contribution: This paper introduces an auditory perception guidance model to enhance the prediction accuracy of mean opinion scores (MOS) for synthetic speech, achieving notable performance improvements over existing models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods largely relied on either expert knowledge-driven approaches or fully data-driven techniques, failing to consistently align with human auditory perception.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines biological auditory modeling with a new semantic distortion framework and a progressive learning strategy, offering a more integrated approach.

key_innovation: The model uniquely employs cochlear-inspired auditory processing to convert acoustic signals into biologically meaningful representations, enhancing the MOS prediction capacity.
real_world_impact: By providing a more reliable automatic speech quality assessment tool, this research has practical implications for improving synthetic speech systems widely used in applications like virtual assistants and accessibility tools.
limitations: No limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.mean opinion score (MOS): **Mean Opinion Score (MOS)** is a common metric used to measure the quality of synthesized speech by averaging scores given by human listeners.
new_terms.residual vector quantization (RVQ): **Residual Vector Quantization (RVQ)** is a technique for capturing semantic distortions by quantizing residuals between raw speech representations and their modeled counterparts.

open_sourcing: The code and checkpoints will be made available in a public repository upon publication.
